alert.note: Alert for Bell; Coryell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 20 at 5:23PM CDT until April 20 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN CORYELL...EAST CENTRAL LAMPASAS AND NORTHERN BELL COUNTIES... At 523 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Temple to near Nolanville to near Copperas Cove, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Killeen, Temple, Copperas Cove, Harker Heights, Belton, Fort Hood, Nolanville, Morgan`s Point Resort, Little River-Academy, Troy, Kempner, Belton Lake, Stillhouse Hollow Lake, Mother Neff State Park, Union Grove, White Hall, Moffat, Izoro, Owl Creek and Meadow Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
